author: cheeky_gorilla
content:
You're a superstar <@308223150725005322>, thanks for sharing! My 2c: Patrick McCorry's recent "How Proof of Stake Ethereum Works" series of articles would be a great addition to this list - all super recent and highly approachable!

https://stonecoldpat.substack.com/p/how-proof-of-stake-ethereum-works

author: e1.profesor
content:
Hello world! üëã 

Could you tell me if the office hours call (https://meet.ethereum.org/epf-office-hours) is open to literally anyone, please?

I'm interested in starting to explore the Ethereum ecosystem in a more technical details, and eventually be able to contribute in a non-trivial manner, and potentially apply to one of the future Fellowship cohorts.

Also, I wanted to ask if there's a link somewhere to the ongoing projects from the current cohort, because I would like - on my own time - to attempt working on some of the project ideas (https://github.com/eth-protocol-fellows/cohort-three/blob/master/projects/project-ideas.md) which haven't been picked up by Fellowship participants.

Alternatively, instead of a link, could you tell me if the "Security System based on Machine Learning" (https://github.com/eth-protocol-fellows/cohort-three/blob/master/projects/project-ideas.md#security-system-based-on-machine-learning) has been picked up by anyone, and if not - if it would be okay for me to start thinking (again, on my own time) about possible ways I could contribute along the lines of such project (outside of the context of the Fellowship programme)?

Thanks very much for your time and understanding! üôè

P.S.: Apologies if this isn't the correct channel/server for my question(s). If that's the case, could you please provide a reference to the correct one, so that I could move my questions there?

author: jimmygchen
content:
Hi <@793850765873250324> , ongoing projects from the current cohort are in the projects folder:
https://github.com/eth-protocol-fellows/cohort-three/tree/master/projects

author: jimmygchen
content: the cohort is permissionless and open to everyone, so yes, feel free to join the office hour call üôÇ

author: e1.profesor
content: Thank you for your time and the informative responses, <@466006586477772831>!
